summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior. Provide English.

Class KVClient: used to push/pull data to/from KVServer. Supports local shared memory if same machine, else TCP/IP RPC. Not thread-safe. Supports CPU-to-CPU communication now; future GPU support. Parameters: ip_config path, num_servers per machine, role. Methods include init, helpers, barrier, client_id, count_nonzero, data_name_list, data_store, delete_data, gdata_name_list, get_data_meta, get_partid, init_data, machine_id, map_shared_data, num_servers, pull, push, register_pull_handler, register_push_handler, role, union.

We need summary: high-level description of class responsibilities.

Business intent: what business problem it solves: distributed key-value store client for data synchronization across machines, enabling efficient data exchange for machine learning or distributed computing.

Keywords: key-value store, client, server, push, pull, shared memory, RPC, CPU communication, distributed, data synchronization, barrier, registration, role, partition, etc.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim. Avoid using method names like "pull" "push"? The instruction says "Do NOT list method names verbatim." So we cannot include method names exactly as they appear. So we must avoid words like "push", "pull", "register_pull_handler". But we can describe functionality without using exact method names. Use synonyms: "send data", "retrieve data", "register callbacks". Avoid "push" and "pull". Use "transfer", "fetch". Avoid "register_pull_handler". Use "set up pull handler". But "pull" is a method name; we should avoid using the word "pull" as a method name. However the word "pull" may appear in description but not as method name? The instruction says "Do NOT list method names verbatim." So we can still use the word "pull" in description if not referencing method name? Safer to avoid. Use "retrieve" instead of "pull". Use "send" instead of "push". Use "set up handlers". Use "union" maybe avoid. Use "combine". Use "barrier" maybe okay as concept but also method name. Might be okay but to be safe we can describe as "synchronization barrier". That's okay.
